evidence: Preheat the oven to 375 °F (191 °C) and line a muffin tin

conversation.text: Hi I am doing well. What is that in Celcius?
375 °F is 191 °C, let me know if you have finished.
Ok I have preheated the oven, what is the next step?
Ok, great. Get out 2 12-hole muffin tins and line each cavity
What should I line it with?
You can either use baking spray or muffin liners. Have you finished this?

conversation.text: Yes, what is next?
Ok mix the cranberries with the sugar

conversation.text: For how many muffins is this recipe?
For 20, if you only have 1 tray you may split them and let the pan cool inbetween cooking and using the pan for the other half
evidence: remove the muffins, and let the pan cool

conversation.text: Ok, thank you. What do I once I have mixed the sugar and berries?

Ok so stir the berries until they have a sugary coating and then set them aside.

conversation.text: I mixed all of them, may I use more walnuts, I have some left over?
The recipe specifically says 65g but if you enjoy them feel free to add some more upto 100g otherwise the flavour may be too different. Lets move onto the wet ingredients
Ok i will add 20g extra. What are the dryingredients
Ok lets add the Dry ingredients, to the bowl with the mixture add 12g of baking powder, 5g of salt, 3g of cinnamon and 1g of nutmeg
Ok do i mix it by hand or with a machine?
You mix by hand using a rubber spatula.
evidence: se a rubber spatula to mix the ingredients until the dry ingredients are absorbed

conversation.text: How will I know if I am done?
When the batter is smooth you are done mixing, if you mix too much the muffins will be tough

conversation.text: Ok, the batter is smooth
Now we will add the cranberries to the bowl so we can fold them in

conversation.text: I have added them, do I fold them in now?
Yes gently fold them in until they are incorporateed, if you want a herbal flavour you can always add minced rosmary, around 2g.

procedure.summary: Preheat the oven to 375 °F (191 °C) and line a muffin tin.
procedure.description: Get out 2 12-hole muffin tins and line each muffin cavity. If you prefer, spray the inside of the tin with baking spray instead of using muffin liners. Then set the pans aside while you make the batter. If you only have 1 muffin tin, bake 1 dozen muffins, remove the muffins, and let the pan cool before baking the remaining 8 muffins.

procedure.summary: Toss the cranberries with the granulated sugar.
procedure.description: Put 2 cups (200 g) of chopped fresh cranberries into a bowl and add 1/2 cup (100 g) of granulated sugar. Use a spoon to stir the cranberries until they're coated with the sugar. Then set the cranberries aside.Tip: Cranberries can be tricky to chop since they roll around. Instead of chopping them by hand, consider pulsing them 2 to 3 times in a blender or food processor.

procedure.summary: Put the remaining ingredients into a large bowl.
procedure.description:
Place 1 1/2 cups (187 g) of all-purpose flour and 1 1/2 cups (194 g) of whole-wheat flour into a bowl with 1/2 cup (170 g) of honey, 2 large eggs, 1 ⁄2 cups (350 ml) of eggnog, ⁄3 cup (160 ml) of coconut oil, 1/2 cup (65 g) of chopped walnuts, and the following dry ingredients:
1 tablespoon (12 g) of baking powder
1 teaspoon (5 g) of salt
1 1/2 teaspoons (3 g) of cinnamon
1/2 teaspoon (1 g) of ground nutmeg

procedure.summary: Stir the batter until it's just combined.
procedure.description: Use a rubber spatula to mix the ingredients until the dry ingredients are absorbed and the batter is smooth. Ensure that you don't stir it too long after this or the muffins will be tough.

Add the sugared cranberries and any juice that's at the bottom of the bowl to the muffin batter. Gently fold the batter up and over the cranberries until they're incorporated. If you'd like to add an herbal flavor, include 1 tablespoon (2 g) of minced fresh rosemary when you add the sugared cranberries.

procedure.summary: Fill 20 of the muffin liners and bake the muffins for 15 to 20 minutes.
procedure.description: Use a spoon or cookie scoop to divide the batter between 20 of the cavities in the muffin tins. Then bake the muffins in the preheated oven for 15 to 20 minutes. To test if the muffins have finished baking, insert a toothpick or skewer into a muffin. If it comes out clean, they're done. If not, bake them for 2 more minutes and check again.

procedure.summary: Serve the muffins warm or cool.
procedure.description: Remove the muffins and turn them out onto a wire rack. You can serve the muffins when they're cool enough to handle but still warm. If you prefer, let the muffins cool completely and then dust them with powdered sugar before serving. Put the leftover muffins in an airtight container and keep them at room temperature for up to 3 to 4 days.
